section:
In the same lateral row, when using 6 MB-2 tiedown devices in an unsymmetrical pattern the amount of vertical restraint is limited to ______ pounds per ring.
7,500
15,000
20,000
25,000

In the same lateral row, when using 6 MB-2 tiedown devices in an unsymmetrical pattern the amount of vertical restraint is limited to ______ pounds per ring.
7,500
15,000
20,000
25,000

Vehicle single axle weights equal to or greater than ________ pounds must be loaded within 8 inches of the aircraft centerline in compartments D, F and G.
15,001
22,001
27,001
36,001

15,001
22,001
27,001

22,001
27,000
27,001
36,000

22,001
27,000
27,001
36,000

The maximum vehicle weight of a tracked vehicle with articulated suspension loaded in E compartment is `________`.
130,000
135,000
165,000
170,900

The maximum vehicle weight of a tracked vehicle with articulated suspension loaded in E compartment is `________`.
130,000
135,000
165,000
170,900

Tracked vehicles with articulated suspension and with wheel weights exceeding `____` lbs (average) must be loaded within 8 inches of aircraft centerline.
2,000
5,000
7,500
9,000

Tracked vehicles with articulated suspension and with wheel weights exceeding `____` lbs (average) must be loaded within 8 inches of aircraft centerline.
2,000
5,000
7,500
9,000

When cargo projects aft of the end of the logistics rails (FS `____`), ensure the ramp toes do not contact the cargo while being raised to the vertical position.
1321
1390
1403
1424

When cargo projects aft of the end of the logistics rails (FS `____`), ensure the ramp toes do not contact the cargo while being raised to the vertical position.
1321
1390
1403
1424

When four snatch blocks are required the 7500 pound cable pull may be increased to `_______` under the winches increased load capability.
8,500 pounds
9,000 pounds
15,000 pounds
20,000 pounds

When four snatch blocks are required the 7500 pound cable pull may be increased to `_______` under the winches increased load capability.
8,500 pounds
9,000 pounds
15,000 pounds
20,000 pounds

The in-flight ramp loadable height capability varies between ______ at the ramp hinge to`______` inches at the end of the ramp.
156, 116
148, 128
138, 96
162, 112

The in-flight ramp loadable height capability varies between ______ at the ramp hinge to`______` inches at the end of the ramp.
156, 116
148, 128
138, 96
162, 112

Spotters are required to observe clearances and to prevent contact with the wing box structure when loading cargo higher than `_____` inches forward of FS`_____`.
148; 937
158; 1165
162; 1074
148; 1074

Spotters are required to observe clearances and to prevent contact with the wing box structure when loading cargo higher than `_____` inches forward of FS`_____`.
148; 937
158; 1165
162; 1074
148; 1074

Replace the cargo winch cable if ________ or more broken wires per strand inch or _________ or more broken wires per cable inch are found.
2; 4
3; 7
4; 7
5; 3

Replace the cargo winch cable if ________ or more broken wires per strand inch or _________ or more broken wires per cable inch are found.
2; 4
3; 7
4; 7
5; 3

Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked to 96 inches shall not exceed `________` pounds.
21,000
23,000
26,000
30,000

Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked to 96 inches shall not exceed `________` pounds.
21,000
23,000
26,000
30,000

Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked above 96 inches (not to exceed 100 inches) shall not exceed `__________` pounds.
20,710
21,000
26,000
27,000

Two or three pallet train weight for cargo secured with nets and stacked above 96 inches (not to exceed 100 inches) shall not exceed `__________` pounds.
20,710
21,000
26,000
27,000

When plywood barriers and chain bridles are installed for forward restraint on palletized cargo, pallets that exceed `________` inches in height will have a minimum of `_______` bridle(s) installed and the minimum thickness for the barrier will be `_______` inches
20; 1; 1/2
30; 2; 3/4
35; 2; 3/4
40; 3; 1/2

When plywood barriers and chain bridles are installed for forward restraint on palletized cargo, pallets that exceed `________` inches in height will have a minimum of `_______` bridle(s) installed and the minimum thickness for the barrier will be `_______` inches
20; 1; 1/2
30; 2; 3/4
35; 2; 3/4
40; 3; 1/2

Crewmembers may travel as MEP for a maximum of `___` hours.
16
18
24
30

Crewmembers may travel as MEP for a maximum of `___` hours.
16
18
24
30

The maximum altitude for emergency airlift of personnel will not exceed flight level `__________`.
100
150
200
250

100
150
200
250

100
150
200
250

130
180
250
350

130
180
250
350

When `____` or more passengers/troops are planned, a pallet position shall be left open to accommodate palletized/floor loaded baggage.
10
20
40
53

10
20
40
53

The maximum FDP for a basic aircrew is `___` hours, (`___` hours when the autopilot is inoperative).
12/16
16/12
24/12
24/16

The maximum FDP for a basic aircrew is `___` hours, (`___` hours when the autopilot is inoperative).
12/16
16/12
24/12
24/16

The maximum crew duty time for a basic C-17 aircrew is `________`.
24 hours
20 hours
18 hours
12 hours

The maximum crew duty time for a basic C-17 aircrew is `________`.
24 hours
20 hours
18 hours
12 hours

Maximum CDT for an augmented aircrew is `____` hours.
16+45
24+15
24+45
26+15

Maximum CDT for an augmented aircrew is `____` hours.
16+45
24+15
24+45
26+15

During reverse taxi operations, obstacles less than or equal to `____` tall require `____` of clearance from the aft end of the ramp in coplanar.
3 feet; 10 feet
5 feet; 10 feet
8 feet; 25 feet
10 feet; 25 feet

During reverse taxi operations, obstacles less than or equal to `____` tall require `____` of clearance from the aft end of the ramp in coplanar.
3 feet; 10 feet
5 feet; 10 feet
8 feet; 25 feet
10 feet; 25 feet

During reverse taxi operations, obstacles greater than `____` tall require `____` of clearance from the aft end of the ramp in coplanar.
8 feet; 25 feet
8 feet; 88 feet
10 feet; 25 feet
10 feet; 88 feet

During reverse taxi operations, obstacles greater than `____` tall require `____` of clearance from the aft end of the ramp in coplanar.
8 feet; 25 feet
8 feet; 88 feet
10 feet; 25 feet
10 feet; 88 feet

Waivers are `___________` the packaging or compatibility requirements of AFMAN 24-204 (I).
the typical way to meet
exceptions to
never allowed for
always approved for

Waivers are `___________` the packaging or compatibility requirements of AFMAN 24-204 (I).
the typical way to meet
exceptions to
never allowed for
always approved for

A leak is a loss of fuel or fluid at a rate, which is readily detected or seen. `_______` drops per minute from a cooling system, crankcase, gear case, or hydraulic system (although not regulated by AFMAN 24-204 (I) is considered a leak).
Two
Three
Four
Five

A leak is a loss of fuel or fluid at a rate, which is readily detected or seen. `_______` drops per minute from a cooling system, crankcase, gear case, or hydraulic system (although not regulated by AFMAN 24-204 (I) is considered a leak).
Two
Three
Four
Five

`_______` or `_______` system leaks, no matter how minor, will cause the item to be frustrated until repaired.
Air Conditioning / Cooling
Fuel / Air Conditioning
Fuel / Brake
Cooling / Brake

`_______` or `_______` system leaks, no matter how minor, will cause the item to be frustrated until repaired.
Air Conditioning / Cooling
Fuel / Air Conditioning
Fuel / Brake
Cooling / Brake

An area extending approximately ______ from the radome of the aircraft is not visible from the pilot or copilot seat due to cockpit height and aircraft fuselage geometry. Ensure all equipment and ground personnel are clear of the non-visibility area before commencing taxi.
25 feet
44 feet
50 feet
144 feet

An area extending approximately ______ from the radome of the aircraft is not visible from the pilot or copilot seat due to cockpit height and aircraft fuselage geometry. Ensure all equipment and ground personnel are clear of the non-visibility area before commencing taxi.
25 feet
44 feet
50 feet
144 feet

When backing, the effective aircraft gross weight can increase up to an additional `___________` pounds and possibly exceed maximum allowable ramp weights.
29,000
50,000
89,000
100,000

When backing, the effective aircraft gross weight can increase up to an additional `___________` pounds and possibly exceed maximum allowable ramp weights.
29,000
50,000
89,000
100,000

Oxygen is supplied to the 48 centerline seat passenger masks via two flexible hoses. Each hose can supply oxygen to as many as seat modules (six seats per module).
3
4
5
6

Oxygen is supplied to the 48 centerline seat passenger masks via two flexible hoses. Each hose can supply oxygen to as many as seat modules (six seats per module).
3
4
5
6

Following an intentional cabin depressurization above 10,000 feet, the cabin must be repressurized to less than `_______` regulators are not reset, subsequent flight above 9,000 feet cabin altitude may deploy the passenger oxygen masks
3,500
8,000
8,500
12,500

Following an intentional cabin depressurization above 10,000 feet, the cabin must be repressurized to less than `_______` regulators are not reset, subsequent flight above 9,000 feet cabin altitude may deploy the passenger oxygen masks
3,500
8,000
8,500
12,500

Below `________` emergency oxygen regulator SURGE MODE lever/three position toggle switch must be positioned to MAN ON/MANUAL ON to provide passenger oxygen.
25,000
20,000
15,000
12,500 </o
